sentences.en: Always keep smile and eye contact, but must not be overly patronizing.
sentences.cn: 始终保持笑容和目光交流, 但是一定不能过于做作.
别计较我这么老气横秋的.

sentences.en: Games start patronizing lot of fans to hang around in Akihabara.
sentences.cn: 许多游戏爱好者开始光顾流连于秋叶原.

sentences.en: His manner, if patronizing, was not unkind.
sentences.cn: 他的态度, 虽然是以恩人自居, 然而并不粗暴.

sentences.en: I don’t mean to sound patronizing.
I simply cannot put up with your abjection to his patronizing tone.
sentences.cn: 我就是受不了你对他那种高高在上的腔调还那么低三下四.

sentences.en: I was only trying to explain; I didn't want to sound patronizing.
sentences.cn: 我只是想解释一下而已，绝无自诩清高之意。

sentences.en: I'm a typical Leo, but I'm trying to overcome my patronizing side.
sentences.cn: 我就是典型的狮子座, 但我正努力克服自己自负的一面.

sentences.en: It is counter-productive to address an interviewee in patronizing tones.
sentences.cn: 以盛气凌人的语气同面试者讲话将会适得其反。

sentences.en: Patronizing these actors was considered a sign of " refinement . "
sentences.cn: 据说这是 风雅 的事.

sentences.en: Rudely, the waiter spoke to me in a patronizing tone.
sentences.cn: 这个服务员很粗鲁, 用高高在上的口气跟我说话.

sentences.en: Some passengers often treat taxi driver with great patronizing disregard.
sentences.cn: 一些乘客常常以恩人自居的漠然对待出租车司机.

sentences.en: The guy sounded so patronizing as if he were the boss of the company.
sentences.cn: 那个人口气好大,好像他是公司的老板似的.

sentences.en: The voice was patronizing and affected, the accent artificial.
sentences.cn: 声音拿腔拿调的，听上去矫揉造作。

sentences.en: When people give you that patronizing look, wink at'em.
sentences.cn: 当人们注目你的时候, 朝他们眨眨眼睛.

trans.tran_cn: 自命为恩人的，屈尊俯就的，要人领情的，傲慢的
trans.tran_en: someone who is patronizing talks to you in a way that shows they think you are less intelligent or important than them
